snippet: Vice President Tariq al-Hashimi’s office said he was in Qatar on a diplomatic visit, but the news angered officials in Baghdad, who said he was not authorized to leave Iraq.
abstract: Office of Tariq al-Hashimi, Iraqi's fugitive vice president, says he is in Qatar on a diplomatic visit, angering officials in Baghdad who say he was not authorized to leave the country; Kurdish government in northern Iraq, in escalation of another festering dispute, announces it will halt oil exports as a rebuke to Iraq's central government.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and DURAID ADNAN

lead_paragraph: Vice President Tariq al-Hashimi’s office said he was in Qatar on a diplomatic visit, but the news angered officials in Baghdad, who said he was not authorized to leave Iraq.

headline.seo: Vice President Tariq al-Hashimi or Iraq Visits Qatar
headline.main: Iraqi Leader Visits Qatar in Defiance of Baghdad
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Leader Visits Qatar In Defiance Of Baghdad
